title: Who were the most valuable players in the NFL this season? Let's stack the top 100
content: We took the MVP conversation beyond Drake Maye vs. Matthew Stafford ... way beyond. Here are the 100 top players of the 2025 season.

title: Mets strike again, add ace Peralta from Brewers
content: The Mets' winterlong pursuit of a front-line starting pitcher ended with them acquiring All-Star Freddy Peralta and right-hander Tobias Myers from the Brewers for prospects Brandon Sproat and Jett Williams.

title: GM Lynch: Aiyuk has played last snap for 49ers
content: At Wednesday's end-of-season news conference, 49ers general manager John Lynch confirmed what has been obvious for months: WR Brandon Aiyuk will not return to the only NFL team he has ever known.

title: 'What was that for?' Osaka asks of terse Cirstea
content: Naomi Osaka received a cool response from Sorana Cirstea after their second-round Australian Open match, as Cirstea was apparently upset with Osaka's efforts to pump herself up during the match.

title: Sources: Bucs stay in South, tab Robinson as OC
content: The Buccaneers are finalizing a deal to hire former Falcons offensive coordinator Zac Robinson as their offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN.

title: Giannis cites chemistry, selfish play after routs
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo says chemistry issues might be contributing to the Bucks' recent penchant for lopsided losses.

title: Knicks win by franchise-best 54, end 4-game skid
content: The Knicks ended their four-game losing streak Wednesday night with the most lopsided victory in franchise history, beating the Nets 120-66.

title: Retiring Wawrinka goes long to reach 3rd round
content: Stan Wawrinka, who will retire at the end of the season, became the first player to reach the third round at a Grand Slam past his 40th birthday since 1978, and he needed 4 hours, 33 minutes to do it.

title: Niners' injury probe includes looking into substation
content: Niners GM John Lynch said the team will look into "everything" to find out why injuries continue to pile up year after year, including an investigation into the viral electrical substation conspiracy theory.

title: 'You should've never been born': How Buss family infighting drove the $10B sale of the Lakers
content: The post-Jerry Buss era was defined by resentment, dysfunction and conflict -- and ended with the loss of the most valuable family-owned franchise in the world.

title: Flagg, Knueppel, Edgecombe: Who is the NBA's No. 1 rookie in our midseason rankings?
content: With the NBA now at the midpoint of its season, ESPN analyst Zach Kram ranks the top 10 rookies based on their performance.

title: Welcoming the HOF Class of 2026: Why Carlos Beltran and Andruw Jones got in
content: Cooperstown welcomed two new players Tuesday night. Here's why the center fielders are headed to the Hall.

title: Indiana repeat? Georgia back on top? Hawai'i in? Who could be in the 2026 CFP
content: It's never too early to look ahead to next season. Some teams look like easy playoff picks, but who rounds out the field?

title: How Cooper Kupp mentored and Davante Adams elevated Puka Nacua's game
content: Puka Nacua's elite performance can be attributed to the mentorship of veteran receivers Cooper Kupp and Davante Adams.

title: Are Patriots QB Drake Maye's turnovers an issue against the Broncos?
content: The Broncos' defense is the best in the league at getting to the quarterback. How will the Patriots respond?

content: Where will national title game standouts Fernando Mendoza and Akheem Mesidor land in Round 1? And could we really see six WRs in the opening 32 picks?

title: Why Frank Nazar is the Blackhawks' perfect complement to Connor Bedard
content: The 22-year-old center is slated to make his return on Thursday to a team still fighting hard to get in the playoff mix.

title: Ranking the top 50 players in the Olympics: Why MacKinnon is No. 1
content: As 12 teams face off for gold in Milan Cortina, here are the players who will have the biggest impact.

title: What NBA greats Kerr, Nash & Co. learned owning LaLiga's Mallorca
content: Steve Kerr and Steve Nash own Mallorca with a former USMNT international and an ex-tennis pro. What has it taught them about sport, leadership and life?

title: UCL talking points: Matchday 8's must-see games, Man City's slump, more
content: What's at stake on the final matchday? Is it time to rule a line through Man City? ESPN's experts answer all the burning questions from the Champions League's penultimate group matches.

title: Liberty, Fever among the top 2026 WNBA schedule reveals on social media
content: The 2026 WNBA schedule is out and teams announced their calendar in their own creative ways on social media.

title: Predicting 68 starting quarterbacks for 2026
content: We're nine months from the 2026 season starting, but we're looking at every power team's QB situation.

title: Reranking men's college basketball Freshman of the Year contenders
content: Darryn Peterson has finally entered the top 10, along with two other players. Cameron Boozer remains No. 1.

title: Bracketology: Don't write off Houston just yet
content: The Cougars remain national title contenders despite falling off the radar at the turn of the calendar year.

title: Power Rankings: Iowa, Ohio State soar into top 10 -- but can they stay there?
content: The Big Ten and Big 12 are winners as Ohio State, Iowa and Baylor crack the top 10. UConn stays No. 1.

title: Bracketology: Big nonconference win boosts Ohio State to a 3-seed
content: Results Sunday and Monday shook up the top 16, and the Buckeyes benefited the most, climbing two seed lines.

title: MMA Rank 50-1: Which stars could shine the brightest in 2026?
content: Makhachev, Topruia or Chimaev? ESPN ranks the top 50 fighters in MMA based on how they will perform in 2026.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Chelsea want Dortmund's Felix Nmecha
content: Dortmund midfielder Felix Nmecha is attracting interest from Manchester United and Chelsea. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Trump unveils 'Board of Peace': India absent from stage; Pak's Shehbaz Sharif joins US Prez
content: Former US President Donald Trump launched his "Board of Peace" initiative at the World Economic Forum in Davos. India received an invitation to join this effort aimed at resolving global conflicts. However, India was not present on the stage during the unveiling. Several countries, including some from the Middle East and Asia, were listed as participants in the initiative.

title: 'Security risk situation has not changed': B'desh says no T20 WC matches in India
content: Bangladesh has reiterated that its refusal to play the upcoming World Cup in India is solely due to security concerns and is a sovereign decision. Government adviser Professor Asif Nazrul criticised the ICC for failing to address Bangladeshâ€™s grievances, while BCB president Aminul Islam Bulbul confirmed the boardâ€™s demand for a neutral venue, insisting the team is ready to play.

title: Delhi excise policy probe: Court acquits Arvind Kejriwal in ED summons case
content: A Delhi court has acquitted former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal in two cases filed by the Enforcement Directorate. These cases stemmed from his failure to appear before the agency in connection with the Delhi excise policy probe. The ED had sought action against Kejriwal for not complying with multiple summons issued under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

title: T20 WC row: 'Concerned' Bangladesh says Mustafizur IPL snub sparked standoff
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board president Aminul Islam Bulbul has revealed that Mustafizur Rahmanâ€™s removal from an IPL team over security concerns triggered Bangladeshâ€™s hardening stance against travelling to India for the T20 World Cup.

title: Workplace shake-up: Deloitte to rename job titles for thousands in the US; â€˜Leaderâ€™ roles added
content: Deloitte is overhauling job titles for all 181,500 US employees starting June 1, 2026, as part of a modernization drive influenced by AI. The consulting giant aims to better align roles with evolving client demands and employee career aspirations. New senior leadership designations will also be introduced, promising greater clarity and market relevance across all divisions.

title: OpenAI concerns: Google AI CEO on Sam Altman; â€˜Maybe heâ€™s realised what everyone is worried aboutâ€™
content: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated no plans for ads in Gemini, deeming OpenAI's ChatGPT ad test a premature revenue push. This comes amid investor concerns about OpenAI's significant spending exceeding revenue, with projections of substantial cumulative losses and unsustainable operational costs for its AI tools.

title: 'Running beautifully': Trump says 'Board of Peace' has started work
content: President Trump unveiled his "Board of Peace" at Davos, a $1 billion initiative aimed at resolving international conflicts.  While many nations, particularly from the Middle East, have confirmed participation, key allies like Britain have expressed doubts.  The announcement follows Trump's frustration over not receiving the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Oâ€™Leary's LinkedIn warning: Employers see missing profiles as red flag; digital presence now key
content: Canadian billionaire Kevin O'Leary issued a stark warning to job seekers, emphasizing that a missing LinkedIn profile is a significant red flag for employers. He stressed that recruiters thoroughly examine online presence, including posts and digital footprints, as a crucial part of the hiring process. O'Leary also highlighted the U.S.

title: PCB investigates financial scam involving Babar, Rizwan; losses could exceed millions
content: Several prominent Pakistani cricketers, including Babar Azam and Shaheen Shah Afridi, are reportedly victims of a massive financial scam. A businessman, who had sponsored PSL franchises, allegedly fled the country after promising profits that never materialized. Players, who invested personal and family funds, now face losing millions, with total investments potentially exceeding one billion rupees.

title: Delhi-NCR air pollution: GRAP Stage-III curbs revoked; quality likely to stay moderate to poor
content: Air quality in Delhi-NCR has improved significantly. The Commission for Air Quality Management has lifted Stage-III restrictions under the Graded Response Action Plan. This means some construction and demolition activities can resume. However, measures under Stage-I and Stage-II remain in effect. Citizens are urged to follow guidelines to maintain better air quality.

title: MBBS counselling halted at SMVD Medical College: Is education being sacrificed for politics?
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Board of Professional Entrance Examinations (BOPEE) has refused fresh MBBS counselling for Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Institute of Medical Excellence students, leaving the allocation of supernumerary seats to the government. Following the National Medical Commissionâ€™s withdrawal of the collegeâ€™s permission for regulatory non-compliance, students now face uncertainty, caught between administrative inaction, political agitation, and questions over merit and accountability.

title: Alex Karp on Europe's tech lag: Palantir CEO flags AI job risks; urges shift to technical skills
content: Palantir CEO Alex Karp warned of Europe's significant lag in digital innovation and AI adoption, citing structural resistance and political inertia. He highlighted AI's potential to revolutionize healthcare and bolster civil liberties, while also predicting job displacement for humanities graduates in favor of technical and vocational roles.

title: 'Taken up stronglyâ€™: Trespassing and vandalism at Indian embassy in Croatiaâ€” what MEA said
content: India has strongly condemned the trespassing and vandalism at its embassy in Zagreb, Croatia, by anti-India elements. The Ministry of External Affairs has urged Croatian authorities to hold the perpetrators accountable, emphasising the inviolability of diplomatic premises under the Vienna Convention. This incident follows a similar event at the Indian Consulate in Seattle last year.

title: India, Australia beware! Pakistan tipped as dark horse for U19 WC title win
content: While India and Australia are favoured for the 2026 ICC Under-19 World Cup, former South Africa spinner Paul Adams highlights Pakistan as a strong contender. Pakistan's recent Under-19 Asia Cup triumph, where they convincingly defeated India, signals their formidable presence and potential to challenge traditional powerhouses in the tournament.

title: MLB trade rumors: Phillies target $7.7mn Red Sox OF for 2026 shakeup
content: Philadelphia Phillies are reportedly eyeing Boston Red Sox outfielder Jarren Duran to bolster their struggling outfield for the 2026 season. Duran offers much-needed speed, defense, and consistent offense, fitting Philadelphia's immediate needs. A potential trade involving Alec Bohm and prospects could reshape both teams, addressing Philadelphia's outfield woes while providing Boston with key pieces.

title: Who is Cece? Twitch streamer at the center of Marvel Rivals Creator Cup controversy
content: Twitch streamer Cecee faced online backlash after a heated incident during a Marvel Rivals tournament.  She insulted a teammate during a live match.  Cecee later apologized, admitting her mistakes as team captain.  She stated she reacted emotionally and failed to de-escalate the situation.  The streamer promised to improve her leadership skills.

title: Patrick Mahomes quote of the day: Never lose hope in tough times
content: Patrick Mahomes might be a young player but the Kansas City Chiefs' star quarterback has easily inspired a generation of fans both on and off the field. As many of the Chiefs' fans remain stressed about his potential return to the field in the next season, Patrick Mahomes' words prove that he is not the one to give up very easily.

title: 'Industry & values have changed': Jaaved Jaaferi reacts to AR Rahmanâ€™s remarks
content: Actor Jaaved Jaaferi, promoting 'Mayasabha', reflected on industry shifts, noting Gen Z's six-second attention span impacts content creation. He linked this to changing values and the business of making projects, not just films. Jaaferi's comments followed AR Rahman's remarks about potential communal bias and power changes affecting his work in Bollywood.

title: Dog-walking row behind him: IAS officer Khirwar returns as MCD chief; strays now his â€˜pet projectâ€™
content: Sanjeev Khirwar, a 1994-batch IAS officer, has been appointed the new municipal commissioner of Delhi, over three years after a controversy led to his transfer out of the capital. He was previously moved following allegations of forcing athletes to end training early at Thyagraj Stadium for his dog walks.

title: Noida techie death case: Police arrest 2 more builders; probe widens
content: Two more builders were arrested in Noida following the tragic death of software engineer Yuvraj Mehta, whose car fell into an unbarricaded, water-filled construction pit. A harrowing video shows Mehta desperately signaling for help with his phone's torch for nearly 90 minutes as a crowd watched helplessly.

title: Mumbai, Pune to get woman mayors: Reservation breakup for 29 corporations in state â€” who gets what
content: Maharashtra's urban development department held its annual lottery, reserving mayoral posts in 29 municipal corporations.  Nine of the 16 reserved seats are for women, ensuring representation for Scheduled Tribes, Scheduled Castes, Other Backward Classes, and the General category. Key cities like Mumbai, Pune, and Nagpur will see women mayors from the General category, while others have specific caste-based reservations.

title: Greenland: Nato chief says talks to focus on keeping Russia, China out
content: Nato chief Mark Rutte revealed that discussions with the US concerning Greenland will prioritize blocking Russian and Chinese military or economic influence in the Danish Arctic territory. This follows President Trump's recent softening of earlier acquisition threats, indicating a "framework" for a deal has been reached.  Allies, especially Arctic members, aim to secure the region.

title: 'Chup chaap ball daal': Rohit Sharma's 'appeal' warning to India spinner
content: Rohit Sharma lauded Tilak Varma's composure and big-match temperament, highlighting his potential for the T20 World Cup. Sharma also humorously advised Kuldeep Yadav to focus on bowling rather than appealing excessively. Both players are crucial for India's title defense campaign.

title: Honour killing in Moradabad? Couple thrashed to death; girl's brother held
content: Bodies of a 24-year-old man and an 18-year-old woman from different communities, who had been missing for three days, were discovered in Moradabad district. Police suspect honour killing, with the woman's brothers arrested for allegedly killing the couple and burying their bodies near a temple.

title: Is Fortnite down? V39.30 update, maintenance schedule and more
content: Fortnite players, get ready for the v39.30 update arriving January 22, 2026. Servers will be down for maintenance starting 4 AM ET. This essential downtime allows for new content and game improvements. Expect to resume playing the popular battle royale game around 6 AM ET. Follow @FortniteStatus for real-time updates on the maintenance progress.

title: 9 deaths, 2 years, 1 campus: Why IIT Kanpur tops Indiaâ€™s IIT suicide toll
content: A recent suicide at IIT Kanpur highlights a severe mental health crisis in premier technical institutes, with the campus accounting for nearly 30% of IIT student deaths in two years. Alumni and faculty point to systemic failures, intense competition, and missed warning signs, urging accountability from the Union education ministry.

title: 'Want to curb fake news': Andhra weighs Australia-style social media ban for children; what we know
content: Andhra Pradesh has formed a Group of Ministers to review social media laws and combat misinformation, fake news, and abusive content targeting women and children. The GoM is studying Australian legislation to ban social media for those under 16 and exploring state-level laws, potentially requesting central government intervention based on their findings.

title: Jharkhandâ€™s new coaching law explained: What the Bill changes for students, parents and institutes
content: Jharkhand will regulate coaching centres under the Jharkhand Coaching Centres (Control and Regulation) Bill, 2025. The framework mandates portal-based registration and campus-wise licensing, caps operating hours, regulates advertising claims, and sets up district committees and a state authority. It also requires mental-health counsellors, student and tutor IDs, fee disclosure, refund policies, bank guarantees, and graded penalties.

title: Ranji: Gill's return ends in a two-ball duck; Jadeja's batting woes continue
content: The Ranji Trophy clash between Punjab and Saurashtra saw senior India players Shubman Gill and Ravindra Jadeja endure forgettable outings on a day of falling wickets. Gill was dismissed for a duck, while Jadeja managed only 7 runs. Saurashtra was bowled out for 172, with Punjab struggling at 87 for 5 by the end of Day 1.

title: KDMC shift sends ripples: MNS crossover leaves Uddhav camp with 'bruises'; BMC race tightens
content: Five MNS corporators in Kalyan Dombivli have backed Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena, allied with BJP, creating a political ripple. This move, aimed at ensuring stability, is a blow to Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena (UBT), which had allied with MNS for civic polls. The development impacts the upcoming Mumbai mayoral race.

title: Dhurandhar OTT release: When and where to stream Ranveer Singh spy-thriller
content: Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, continues its impressive box office run, grossing over Rs 829 crore. The action-thriller is set for a digital premiere on Netflix on January 30. This move follows a lucrative Rs 130 crore deal for streaming rights, including the sequel, highlighting the film's significant commercial appeal and Ranveer Singh's market influence.

title: 'BJP wants king's rule': Rahul Gandhi urges 'poor' to unite against VB-G RAM G Act
content: Addressing the National MGNREGA Workersâ€™ Convention organised by the Rachnatmak Congress, Rahul Gandhi said PM Modi wants to finish the concept of Panchayati Raj and alleged that the ruling BJP wants an India "where the King decides everything". With the new law, the Centre will decide the work and allocation of funds with BJP-ruled governments always getting precedence, he said.

title: Giannis blasts Bucks after crushing loss to OKC
content: Milwaukee's season hit a new low as they were outplayed by the Oklahoma City Thunder, leading to Giannis Antetokounmpo's blunt assessment of the team's chemistry issues. He expressed frustration with players being selfish and not playing together, highlighting a lack of effort and a tendency to try and win games individually.

title: Small pockets of land, Golden Dome: Trumpâ€™s Greenland U-turn and the â€˜framework dealâ€™
content: US President Trump claims a framework deal on Arctic sovereignty and tariffs with Nato chief Rutte, sparking confusion. Denmark and Greenland deny any Nato mandate for such talks. The proposed deal involves US military bases with limited sovereignty and a missile defence system, aiming to counter Russia and China's influence.

title: 10 must-see WNBA games for the 2026 season
content: the WNBA released its 2026 regular-season schedule on friday . the league will tip off its 30th season on may 8 . at the top of the list is a new CBA . a moratorium on league business as negotiations continue .

title: ðŸ’¯ Arizona high schooler breaks scoring record
content: Adrian Stubbs needed just three quarters to drop 100 points in 109-25 victory at Yuma Kofa . the 5-foot-10 guard broke the previous record of 75 points held by George McCormick since 1966 . he's not on a short list for can't-miss NIL targets for major companies .

title: The Hall of Fame's starting pitcher problem -- and what it means for today's aces
content: CC Sabathia is the only starting pitcher voted into the Hall of Fame this decade . the 2010s saw a spate of starters enshrined, a group composed largely of the last of the greats who were used in a more or less traditional fashion .

title: How to reach the UCL knockouts: Can Chelsea, BarÃ§a avoid the playoff round?
content: the knockout rounds of the 2025-26 UEFA champions league are fast approaching . the final matchweek of the league phase must be played, and the stakes could hardly be higher for some of the continent's biggest clubs . liverpool , barcelona , chelsea and manchester city also competing for top eight spots .

title: Would the Raiders trade the No. 1 pick? Will the Chiefs go RB?
content: Mel Kiper Jr. breaks down why the Raiders would benefit from drafting Fernando Mendoza as the no. 1 pick in the 2026 draft . the rest of the top 10 also offers intrigue . how can the Titans best support quarterback Cam Ward at no. 4?

title: Barnwell sorts out the wide receiver market: 20 free agents, trade targets and cut candidates
content: the 49ers are competing for a trip to the super bowl this weekend in the NFC Championship Game . the two most productive wideouts in football are the Rams ' Puka Nacua and the Seahawks' Jaxon Smith-Njigba . both teams made significant receiver additions this past offseason .

title: Midseason report card: Cooper Flagg 'better than advertised'
content: Cooper Flagg is the youngest player in NBA history to surpass 40 points in a game . he is expected to be the rare no. 1 pick who gets playoff experience right away . the mavs are 18-26 and in 12th place in the Western Conference .

title: Was A Victim Of Fight Between Rahul, Priyanka Gandhi: Himanta Sarma To NDTV
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has alleged cracks between the Gandhi siblings, ripping into the top Gandhi family members during his Davos debut.

title: 'No Nuclear Threat During Operation Sindoor': Nuclear Watchdog Chief To NDTV
content: The head of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), Rafael Mariano Grossi, has stated that there was no indication of any involvement of nuclear weapons during the India-Pakistan conflict in 2025.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why India Must Applaud - And Learn From - Carney's Davos Speech
content: In the current world order, while hegemons can go it alone, everyone else is on the menu if they aren't at the table. That is the takeaway from Carney's speech, and that is what India needs to acknowledge as it tries to chart a course of its own.

title: Adani Energy Solutions Posts Strong Q3 Results, EBITDA Touches All-Time High
content: Adani Energy Solutions Limited (AESL) on Thursday reported a 30 per cent year-on-year (YoY) rise in its adjusted profit after tax (PAT) for the third quarter of the current financial year (Q3 FY26).

title: IndiGo Reports 78% Slump In December Quarter Net Profit
content: India's biggest airline, IndiGo, on Thursday reported a 78 per cent slump in December quarter net profit as flight disruptions and implementation of the new labour code took a toll on its earnings.

title: 10 Army Personnel Killed, 10 Injured As Vehicle Falls Into Gorge In J&K's Doda
content: Ten army personnel were killed and ten others injured when their vehicle skidded off the road and fell into a gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Doda on Thursday, officials said.

title: Told IndiGo To Dismiss Senior Vice President: Centre To Delhi High Court
content: The government today told the Delhi High Court that it asked IndiGo to dismiss its senior vice president following the massive disruption in flights in December last year due to inefficient planning.

title: Opinion: Opinion | India And Bangladesh: Are We Missing The Woods For The Trees?
content: The present bilateral disengagement between Delhi and Dhaka can lead to disastrous consequences, ones that would be difficult to undo.

title: Trump Unveils Board Of Peace On Gaza, Which Has Pak Among Members
content: US President Donald Trump formally announced the first charter of his 'Board of Peace', which is a body for resolving international conflicts and has a $1 billion price tag for permanent membership.

title: Green Tribunal Seeks Authorities' Reply On Waterlogging At Noida Techie Death Site
content: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has initiated suo motu proceedings in response to the tragic drowning of software engineer Yuvraj Mehta in a severely waterlogged trench at a commercial site in Noida.

title: "Felt Like A Dog": Flier's Big Allegation Against Crew. What Air India Said
content: An incident on an international Air India flight has raised serious questions about passenger rights, with a passenger alleging misconduct by the crew after he asked for a non-vegetarian meal that he had pre-ordered.

title: 8 Maoists Killed In Anti-Maoist Operation In Jharkhand
content: At least eight Maoists are said to have been killed on Thursday during a large-scale anti-Naxal operation being undertaken by multiple teams comprising 1,500 personnel from CRPF's CoBRA commando unit in Jharkhand, officials said.

title: 'Has He Ever Made Tea? Drama For Votes': M Kharge's "Chaiwala" Jab At PM
content: In a remark that is sure to spark a massive political row, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge has said Prime Minister Narendra Modi falsely claims he was a "chaiwala" (tea seller) just to get votes.

title: Wounded Ukrainian Veterans Find Healing On Stage
content: Like the other veterans in his Kyiv-based group of around 15 actors, Ukrainian soldier Onopriienko has found healing and fulfilmenton stage.

title: Millions In US Brace For Potentially Catastrophic Ice Storm: What To Know By Numbers
content: Millions of Americans from New Mexico to the Carolinas are bracing for a potentially catastrophic ice storm that could crush trees and power lines and knock out power for days.

title: Ecuador Announces Trump-style Tariffs On Colombia Over Drugs
content: Ecuador's President Daniel Noboa announced 30 percent tariffs on imports from Colombia, accusing its neighbor of failing to help fight drug cartels.

title: 'Too Dangerous To Go To Hospital': Glimpse Into Iran's Protest Crackdown
content: Young protesters shot in the back, shotgun pellets fired in a doctor's face, wounded people afraid to go to hospital: "Every family has been affected" by the deadly crackdown on Iran's recent wave of demonstrations.

title: US Set To Officially Quit World Health Organisation
content: The US is due to officially exit the World Health Organisation on Thursday, in the face of warnings it will hit both US health and global health

title: Though court dismisses government claim on Cheruvally estate, it says Ayana Trust ownership not indisputable
content: Stateâ€™s primary contention was that Cheruvally estate is recorded as Pandaravakapattom in 1910 Settlement Register, considered a fundamental document for determining propertyâ€™s original character. However, court held that Settlement Register alone cannot be treated as conclusive proof of continuing government ownership

title: CPI(M) general secretary M.A. Baby wins cross-party support after plate-washing video sparks trolls
content: Leaders across party lines defend CPI(M) general secretary, calling the act a matter of habit and a rejection of feudal attitudes

title: Tourism push to turn Devikulam into wedding, conference destination
content: State plans conference halls and guest facilities to ease pressure on Munnar and attract high-value visitors.

title: Three killed, 14 injured as bus collides with lorry in Nandyal of A.P.
content: The bus driver lost control over the wheels after the front right tyre burst and rammed the vehicle into a lorry on the otherside of the road

title: Watch: Uttar Pradesh SIR: Why were so many voters deleted?
content: The post SIR draft voters list of the Uttar Pradesh was published on January 6 after a 62 day process of enumeration by BLOs. A whopping 2.89 crore names have been deleted in the 2025 electoral rolls of UP. Who are these voters whose names have been deleted in Indiaâ€™s largest State? The Hinduâ€™s Sreeparna Chakrabarty traveled across UP to find out more.

title: CFTRI innovations hit global markets through Keralaâ€™s Kudumbashree
content: The collaboration focuses on empowering women entrepreneurs through scientifically validated, scalable and market-ready food technologies

title: Tirumala gears up for â€˜Ratha Saptamiâ€™ on January 25
content: The celestial procession of Lord Malayappa Swamy riding seven vahanams from 5.30 a.m. to 9 p.m. along the four mada streets will be a highlight of the festival

title: Death of youth: Shimjitha files sexual assault complaint
content: She, currently lodged in judicial custody at the Manjeri jail, emailed the complaint to the Payyannur police on Thursday

title: Villagers protest against closure of govt. schools in Sitnoor
content: They express strong opposition to what they term an anti-people education policy of the Congress government in the State

title: AI to help check genuineness of farm data in A.P.
content: The technology set for rollout across the State soon will automatically verify and authenticate images, locations and timelines so as to ensure that field-level data reflects actual on-ground condition

title: Press Club of India criticises J&K Police over â€˜oral summonsâ€™ to journalists
content: The PCI flags that such arbitrary actions create an atmosphere of fear. Stating that a reporter had to spend 15 hours in police station over four days and was told to sign a bond that he would not â€˜disturb the peaceâ€™, the Press Club says it indicated the harassment being unleased on journalists in the region.

title: State government urged to allocate 30 MW solar energy to Annamayya district
content: Collector directs officials to fast-track all pending procedures related to APSPDCL and NREDCAP solar projects in the district

title: â€˜Suppressing Karnataka will adversely affect entire countryâ€™
content: The Governorâ€™s address said that VB-G RAM (G) ActÂ â€˜reinstates migration to cities in search of employmentâ€™ which the earlier MGNREGA Act had sought to mitigate

title: Andhra Pradesh Home Minister Anitha stresses on sufficient budgetary support to strengthen police force
content: Providing resources and facilities to the police personnel should be treated as a key component of the Home Departmentâ€™s budget planning, she says

title: IAF unhappy over fee being charged from spectators for Nashik air show
content: The district collector had recently announced that the funds collected would be given to the soldiersâ€™ welfare fund, a local official said

title: Nine villages declared as tobacco-free in Mandya district
content: The nine villages are Chikkarsikere and Kadalipura in Maddur taluk, Chagashettahalli and Melukote in Pandavapura taluk, Naguvinahalli and Karekura in Srirangapatna and Gollarahalli, T. Channapura and Tigalarapalya villages in Nagamangala taluk of Mandya district

title: Build rest shelters for pourakarmikas: Safai Karmachari Commission
content: The Commission has sought urgent steps in Mysuru to provide life insurance coverage, proper wages and PFâ€“ESI payments to sanitation workers

title: Noida techie death: Two more builders arrested
content: The police also lodged a separate FIR in connection with the case and booked five named officials of the two real estate firms, charging them with violating environmental and pollution norms

title: Pourakarmikas urged to voice grievances; Commission assures resolution
content: Sanitation workers begin work before the rest of society to keep cities and villages clean and healthy, says Karnataka State Safai Karmachari Commission chairman P. Raghu

title: SIT summons K.T.Rama Rao in phone tapping probe
content: The summons comes days after former Minister and Siddipet MLA T. Harish Rao appeared before the SIT on January 20 in connection with the same case.

title: Expedite projects committed in Andhra Pradesh, Chief Minister Naidu tells TATA Sons Chairman in Davos
content: Deliberating on the progress of the TCS unit in Visakhapatnam, Amaravati Quantum Valley, and the proposed solar power projects in Kurnool, the Chief Minister urges TATA Group to partner with the government in the construction of sports cities and explore investment opportunities in the tourism sector

title: Give special attention to pilgrim convenience, safety for Ratha Saptami: TTD EO
content: TTD announces cancellation of all â€˜arjitha sevasâ€™, special darshans, VIP break darshans (except protocol dignitaries on the festival day) and issuance of SSD tokens in Tirupati from January 24 to 26

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Two accused in Zubeen Garg death case withdraw bail petitions
content: The Kamrup Metropolitan District and Sessions Court was hearing the bail pleas of five of the seven accused when Mr. Mahanta and Sandipan Garg's lawyers withdrew their petitions.

title: A.P. govt. mulling ban social media for children below 16 years: Lokesh
content: Youngsters below a certain age should not be on social media platforms as they do not fully understand the content they are exposed to, says the IT and HRD Minister

title: India deeply engaged on trade matters: Vaishnaw on Trump's remarks on U.S. deal
content: Given India's position and deep engagement on trade matters, it is very encouraging, says Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in a statement

title: Mysuru to host creative session with focus on music, theatre and science
content: The programme invites audiences to experience how artistic expression and scientific thought intersect, influence, and enrich one another.

title: 1,234 legal literacy clubs launched in Shivamogga schools
content: The clubs, aimed at spreading awareness about rights, duties and laws among students, have been set up in select government, aided and private schools as well as pre-university colleges across the district

title: Australia shooting: 3 dead in New South Wales, town in lockdown; accused at large
content: Security with rifles are positioned on the sails of the Sydney Opera House ahead of a National Day of Mourning event in Sydney. title: Re-investigation ordered into tribal manâ€™s unnatural death near Kozhikode Medical College Hospital in 2023
content: Viswanathan of Wayanad was found dead a couple of days after he was allegedly humiliated by a group of men accusing him of theft on February 9, 2023. Kozhikode Principal Sessions Court orders to submit re-investigation report within two months

title: Woman sentenced to life imprisonment for killing infant son in Kannur
content: The mother threw the one-and-a-half-year-old child into the sea at Thayyil in Kannur on February 17, 2020

title: 12 sailors rescued from sinking Bangladeshi vessel in West Bengal river
content: Officials said they are examining whether poor visibility due to fog or a mechanical fault led to the mishap

title: Bangladesh wonâ€™t play T20 World Cup in India, vows to â€˜keep fightingâ€™
content: The Bangladesh Cricket Board said ICC did not do justice by not shifting Bangladeshâ€™s league matches to Sri Lanka; it said the â€œsecurity concern was not based on abstract analysisâ€

title: 'Farm Guards' deployed at Aralam to keep wild elephants away from human settlements
content: The devices, with sensors, emit loud alarm sounds and intense flashing lights when elephants approach, forcing them to retreat

title: Large flight disruption at IndiGo cost the airline â‚¹577 crore
content: CEO Pieter Elbers didnâ€™t answer questions from analysts on how the airline was reviewing its pilot recruitment plan to comply with the new duty norms, and the exact number of pilots it is short of

title: Twenty20 party in Kerala joins NDA
content: Sabu M. Jacob says Twenty20 has â€˜eschewed its decade-old founding conceptâ€™ of giving a wide berth to coalition politics after the party faced an almost existential electoral threat from â€˜an unlikely cabalâ€™ of LDF, UDF, SDPI and Welfare Party of India in local body elections

title: Bengaluru airport ground staff arrested for sexually harassing Korean businesswoman
content: The complainant told the police that Ahmed frisked her intrusively and continued to do so despite her objections. He allegedly left after saying â€œthank youâ€.

title: Merely calling hypertension lifestyle disorder not enough to deny disability pension: Delhi HC
content: The two-judge Bench, in a judgment, states that lifestyles varied from one individual to another, and there was an obligation on the medical board to give reasons for its conclusion after duly examining the individual

title: Water crisis draining Kochi Corporationâ€™s coffers
content: Corporation has been deploying tankers to bridge supply deficit following collapse of a water storage chamber of Kerala Water Authority at Thammanam and breakdowns at  Pazhoor pump house

title: UPC Volt to set up AI ready data centre at Telanganaâ€™s Bharat Future City; â‚¹5,000 crore investment over 5 years estimated
content: The facility is expected to create more than 3,000 direct & indirect jobs during construction and over 800 direct and indirect jobs during operation

title: Two more bodies retrieved from Bhadra canal in Shivamogga district of Karnataka
content: On January 18, the four persons had left their home in Arebilachi village on two bikes to wash clothes in the canal The search operation began on January 18 soon after four members of a family were reported missing

title: 10 soldiers killed as Army vehicle falls into gorge in J&Kâ€™s Doda
content: The vehicle, carrying 17 personnel, was heading towards a high-altitude post when its driver lost control and the vehicle plunged into a 200-foot-deep gorge

title: Will take up issue of MGNREGA repeal strongly during Parliamentâ€™s Budget session: Kharge
content: Has Narendra Modi ever made tea or moved around train compartments with a kettle, the Congress chief asked, addressing the National MGNREGA Workersâ€™ Convention organised by the Rachnatmak Congress

title: NIA court sentences man to 10 years of imprisonment in Bengal's LeT recruitment module case
content: The National Investigation Agency took over the case from the West Bengal Police in April 2020 and arrested Sayyad M. Idris, along with another person

title: Sangeetha vs. Geetham: Madras High Court reserves judgment in trademark dispute
content: Justice Senthilkumar Ramamoorthy, however, permits the parties to attempt for an out-of-court settlement before he could pronounce orders, and inform him if it fructifies

title: Material procurements by DISCOMs: APERC to issue regulation or guidelines for curbing irregularities
content: APERC in-charge chairman Venkata Rama Reddy said the move would exercise greater control over procurements by DISCOMs to rid transactions of corruption

title: Annamalai University employees stage protest demanding release of arrears
content: The employees have been forced to strike as their demands have not been fulfilled despite promises by the State government, a spokesperson of the JAC said

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: Vigilance court grants one-day SIT custody of tantri Kandararu Rajeevaru
content: Rajeevaru is the 13th accused in the case. He has been shifted to SIT office in Thiruvananthapuram for interrogation

title: Frequent leopard sightings at Marayeepalayam hillock in Erode trigger panic among residents
